segments.text: Mom , this is your third bowl of rice !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I know but I have no choice . My stomach just keeps crying for more and more .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Why ? I never saw you eat so much before .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I've been going to the gym these days . The exercise makes me hungry all the time .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: So your stomach is the one that actually gets a lot of work-out .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: This way you'll probably put on more weight . Will you give up ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Surely not . I can feel the results . I'm starting to feel different now .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Then how are you gonna deal with the problem of getting extra weight ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I'm planning to meet my personal trainer to have the work-out plan fixed .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Oh , I've got an idea . Why don't you ask Dad to go with you ? He badly needs some exercise .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Your father is a bit too timid . He even doesn't know how to introduce himself .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: He can just say , I'm Benjamin . I'm new and shy .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Girl , don't make fun of your Daddy . But I can introduce him to my personal trainer . Maybe one day he will be a fitness freak instead of a cough potato .
segments.speaker: S2
